titleStmt.title: Letter from John G. Neihardt to Alice Culler Neihardt, January 30, 1929
titleStmt.author: Neihardt, John G.

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Letter from John G. Neihardt to Alice Culler Neihardt, January 30, 1929

msIdentifier.repository: John G. Neihardt Center Research Library, Aly Collection

div1.fw: CHRISTODORA HOUSE 147 AVENUE B. NEW YORK, N.Y. TELEPHONE ALGONQUIN 8400
div1.p: The reception at Lady Speyer's last night was even more of a success than the Annual Dinner So many famous people in one relatively small ! And five spirits too! I was The drawing card & my stunt really fowled them over. I was in fine shope & I talked 20 minutes before I read. They aren't used to a headlong torrent like that, & they sat like charmed birds. There was a genuine outburst of enthusiasm. After my stunt the whale party rushed to the dining room where a butler & four waiters crammed everybody witha really wonderful suffer. We ate in a crowd standing up mostly.

I'll try to name a few of the celebrities Padraic Column the Irish poet; Arthur Guterman, Kreynborg, Beynner. Edwin , Rose O'Neill, George Wharton Stork, Edward Davison, the British poet, Sylvia Warner, the British novelist; Mr. Filsinger, husband of Sara Teardale who is sick in bed & sent her regards), David Laurence, Leonora Speyer, Curtis Hidden Page, Miss La Folette etc. etc. Many others It was a great triumph for me. Old Market am got up & said: "I think I have never been more deeply moved tahn by Neihardt's epic reading. He has done for the prairie what Hower did for I
div1.fw: CHRISTODORA HOUSE 147 AVENUE B. NEW YORK, N.Y. TELEPHONE ALGONQUIN 8400
div1.p: all the guns jammed round me & expressed genuine enthusiasm for my "great work". Old Markham, the dear man, read a favorite of mine to the whole company just for me. I wish you had been there, Mama.
